attributes.action: Debate impact of Electoral Fraud on the current government and public confidence
attributes.additional_details:
29 Parliamentary Constituencies could be affected by Election Expenses Fraud with evidence already suggesting overspend on a massive scale.

Even if all these seats were re-run, confidence in the current electoral system has been devastated because this is being linked directly to members of the Prime Minister's own staff.

The Electoral Commission has levied a record-breaking fine but this in no way restores confidence in our political system.

Debate the merits of a NEW General Election
attributes.background: Revelations of Electoral Fraud are having a damning effect on the current Government and it's ability to operate in the best interests of the country. Irrespective of any criminal proceedings this needs to be debated and a new General Election called to restore confidence in our political system

rejection.details:
As you will know, there will be an early general election on 8 June. The House of Commons debated this on Wednesday 19 April. You can read the debate here:

https://hansard.parliament.uk/commons/2017-04-19/debates/0DE53CE3-2E92-44E8-A3BE-A7BEE2D9F075/EarlyParliamentaryGeneralElection
